message_1: A factory produces 2000 units of a product per day using 10 machines. If they add 2 more machines to the factory, how many more units of the product will they be able to produce per day assuming that each machine produces an equal amount?
message_2:
First, we need to find out how many units each machine produces per day. We can do this by dividing the total units produced by the number of machines:

2000 units / 10 machines = 200 units per machine per day

Now that we know each machine produces 200 units per day, we can calculate how many more units will be produced with the addition of 2 more machines:

2 machines * 200 units per machine per day = 400 units

So, with the addition of 2 more machines, the factory will be able to produce 400 more units of the product per day.
